meanings.definition: To lift or pull up suddenly or forcefully.
meanings.sent1: He hoicks the heavy box onto the shelf.
meanings.sent2: She hoicks the weeds out of the garden with determination.
meanings.sent3: The little boy hoicks his toy up high, pretending it's flying.
meanings.sent4: The crane hoicks the container off the ship effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The magician hoicks the rabbit out of the hat with a flourish.

meanings.definition: An exclamation used to urge on hounds in hunting.
meanings.sent1: Hoicks! The hounds eagerly follow the scent trail.
meanings.sent2: The hunter shouted 'Hoicks!' to encourage the hounds.
meanings.sent3: Hoicks! Let's see if the hounds can catch the fox this time.
meanings.sent4: With a loud 'Hoicks!', the hunt master set the hounds off.
meanings.sent5: The old man's 'Hoicks!' echoed through the forest, spurring the hounds on.

meanings.sent1: The hunters' hoicks echoed through the valley.
meanings.sent2: The hoicks of the hounds signaled the start of the hunt.
meanings.sent3: The loud hoicks of the hunters startled the birds in the trees.
meanings.sent4: The haunting hoicks of the wolves filled the night.
meanings.sent5: The rhythmic hoicks of the hunters created an eerie atmosphere in the forest.
